text.section:
A person who transports other tobacco products by vehicle on a public road shall have in the vehicle a delivery ticket or an invoice that states:
the name and address of the seller or consignor;
the name and address of a buyer or consignee who is:
a person in the State authorized by Title 12 of the Tax - General Article to hold other tobacco products on which the tobacco tax has not been paid; or
a person in another jurisdiction authorized to hold other tobacco products on which the tax imposed by that jurisdiction has not been paid; and
the quantity and brands of the other tobacco products that are being transported.

The Comptroller by regulation may require a common carrier that brings other tobacco products into the State to submit to the Comptroller a copy of any freight bill relating to the other tobacco products shipment.
